title: 2  PracTwo
text:
2.1 Quarto
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: 2  PracTwo
2  PracTwo
2  PracTwo
text:
2.5 Question 4

it <- irnorm(5)

set.seed(1234)
largest <- foreach(i = 1:3, .combine = cbind) %do% {
  v = nextElem(it)
  max(v)
}

largest

     result.1  result.2  result.3
[1,] 1.084441 0.5060559 0.9594941

title: 2  PracTwo
text:
2.6 Question 5

it <- irnorm(5)

c5 <- makeCluster(3)
clusterExport(c5, "max")
set.seed(1234)
vl <- list(nextElem(it), nextElem(it), nextElem(it))
system.time({
parLapply(c5,vl, max)
})

   user  system elapsed 
      0       0       0 

set.seed(1234)
system.time({
largest <- foreach(i = 1:3, .combine = cbind) %do% {
  v = nextElem(it)
  max(v)
}
})

   user  system elapsed 
      0       0       0 

set.seed(1234)
system.time({
replicate(3, max(v = nextElem(it)))
})

   user  system elapsed 
      0       0       0 

stopCluster(c5)

title: index
text:
0.1 Quarto
## Below is my link for github
# https://github.com/RongyuZhang/PracOne
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: index
text:
0.2 Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
